history.proof: intros u_n_leq_n. unfold ex_lim_seq. exists (Lim_seq u). apply Lim_seq_correct. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment u : nat -> R u_n_leq_n : forall n : nat, u (S n) <= u n Unable to unify "u (S ?M2369) < u ?M2369 \\/ u (S ?M2369) = u ?M2369" with "exists l : Rbar, is_lim_seq u l".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
u: nat -> R

Goal:
(forall n : nat, u (S n) <= u n) -> ex_lim_seq u

Premises:
ex_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : Rbar, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
is_lim_seq_decr_compare : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : R), is_lim_seq u l -> (forall n : nat, u (S n) <= u n) -> forall n : nat, l <= u n
ex_lim_seq_ext : forall u v : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> ex_lim_seq u -> ex_lim_seq v
ex_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> ex_lim_seq u -> ex_lim_seq v
is_lim_seq_incr_compare : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : R), is_lim_seq u l -> (forall n : nat, u n <= u (S n)) -> forall n : nat, u n <= l
is_lim_seq_ext : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
ex_lim_seq_incr_1 : forall u : nat -> R, ex_lim_seq u < -> ex_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (S n))
Lim_seq_correct : forall u : nat -> R, ex_lim_seq u -> is_lim_seq u (Lim_seq u)
ex_lim_LimSup_LimInf_seq : forall u : nat -> R, ex_lim_seq u < -> LimSup_seq u = LimInf_seq u
ex_lim_seq_subseq : forall (u : nat -> R) (phi : nat -> nat), filterlim phi eventually eventually -> ex_lim_seq u -> ex_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (phi n))
is_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
Lim_seq_subseq : forall (u : nat -> R) (phi : nat -> nat), filterlim phi eventually eventually -> ex_lim_seq u -> Lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (phi n)) = Lim_seq u
is_LimInf_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < l0 + eps) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> l0 - eps < u n) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> M < u n | m_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_LimSup_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ l0 - eps < u n) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < l0 + eps) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ M < u n | m_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
ex_lim_seq_incr_n : forall (u : nat -> R) (N : nat), ex_lim_seq u < -> ex_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (n + N)%nat)
ex_finite_lim_seq_correct : forall u : nat -> R, ex_finite_lim_seq u < -> ex_lim_seq u /\ is_finite (Lim_seq u)
Alembert_C4 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
tech13 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> exists k0 : R, k < k0 < 1 /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> Rabs (An (S n) / An n) < k0)
tech1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> 0 < An n) -> 0 < sum_f_R0 An N
is_lim_seq_incr_1 : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l < -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (S n)) l
Un_growing = fun Un : nat -> R => forall n : nat, Un n <= Un (S n) : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
ex_lim_seq_dec : forall u : nat -> R, {ex_lim_seq u} + {~ ex_lim_seq u}
is_LimSup_LimInf_lim_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_lim_seq u l
Alembert_C5 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C2 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
is_lim_LimSup_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> is_LimSup_seq u l
is_lim_LimInf_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq u l
is_lim_seq_subseq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) (phi : nat -> nat), filterlim phi eventually eventually -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (phi n)) l
is_LimSup_seq_unique : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq u l -> LimSup_seq u = l
is_lim_seq_unique : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> Lim_seq u = l
is_LimInf_seq_unique : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimInf_seq u l -> LimInf_seq u = l
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
ex_LimInf_seq : forall u : nat -> R, {l : Rbar | is_LimInf_seq u l}
ex_LimSup_seq : forall u : nat -> R, {l : Rbar | is_LimSup_seq u l}
seq.nth_iota : forall p m n i : nat, is_true (ssrnat.leq (S i) n) -> seq.nth p (seq.iota m n) i = ssrnat.addn m i
is_lim_seq' = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, eventually (fun n : nat => Rabs (u n - l0) < eps) | p_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => M < u n) | m_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n < M) end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
ex_finite_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : R, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_lim_seq_spec : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq' u l < -> is_lim_seq u l
is_lim_seq_incr_n : forall (u : nat -> R) (N : nat) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l < -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (n + N)%nat) l
ssrnat.eqSS : forall m n : nat, eqtype.eq_op (S m) (S n) = eqtype.eq_op m n
seq.nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), is_true (ssrnat.leq (S i) n) -> seq.nth x0 (seq.mkseq f n) i = f i

```coq
intros u_n_leq_n.
unfold ex_lim_seq.
exists (Lim_seq u).
apply Lim_seq_correct.
apply u_n_leq_n.
Qed.
```
